container.heading: Relocation of the Site of an Existing Dwelling on a Farm Subject to an Agricultural Land Preservation Easement

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter establishes the criteria and eligibility for the approval of the relocation of the site of an existing dwelling on a farm subject to the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Program.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.

"Existing dwelling" means a building, structure, trailer, or mobile home that was designated by the landowner and recognized by the Foundation and the county as an existing dwelling at the time of the establishment of an agricultural land preservation district or sale of the Agricultural Preservation Easement, whether or not the dwelling was occupied at the time of the sale.
"Farm" means any land subject to an agricultural land preservation easement or district agreement.
"Foundation" means the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation.
Restoration to Agricultural Use.
"Restoration to agricultural use" means to alter the land to open space so that it may produce a crop or be used for livestock.
"Restoration to agricultural use" does not include altering an existing dwelling to another use as an accessory farm building.
Requests for Approval.
The approval to relocate the 1-acre site of any dwelling by the Foundation is not an absolute right of a landowner.
Requests shall be reviewed on a case-by-case basis, and approved if consistent with the guidelines established by this chapter.
Each request shall be reviewed to determine if:
The proposed new site for any new dwelling will adversely affect farming operations; and
The site where the dwelling exists at the time of the request may be restored to agricultural use.
Dwelling Relocation Criteria.
A request to relocate the site of an existing dwelling on a farm may not be approved by the Foundation if it increases the residential development or the number of dwellings on the farm.
The proposed new site for a new dwelling:
Is subject to the Foundation's approval; and
May not be located in an area that interferes with any agricultural use.

The Foundation's approval for a new site for an existing dwelling shall be conditioned upon the removal of the existing dwelling, and restoration of the existing dwelling site to agricultural use, within 60 days after the use and occupancy permit is issued for the new dwelling, or sooner, if required under county law.

A request to relocate the 1-acre site of any proposed new dwelling may not be approved unless the landowner can demonstrate to the Foundation that the existing dwelling site can be restored to agricultural use.
A landowner's request to relocate the site of an existing dwelling may not be approved if its purpose is solely for aesthetic reasons.

section.heading: Application Procedure.
section.text: Before the Foundation may consider and approve a landowner's request to relocate the site of an existing dwelling, all of the following shall be filed with the Foundation:

para.text: A written application for the relocation of a dwelling which has been completed and signed by all titled landowners, which shall include the following:
A map that clearly indicates:
The property boundaries of the easement property;
The location of, and proposed access to, the new site of the proposed dwelling;
The location of and access to the existing dwelling; and
The location of Class I, II, and III soils;
Photographs of the property showing views of the property from the nearest roads;
A description of the farm operation;

A written statement from the landowner that the existing dwelling shall be removed at the landowner's expense and the existing dwelling site restored to agricultural use within 60 days after a use and occupancy permit is issued for the new dwelling, subject to the Foundation's inspection; and
A detailed description showing how the landowner proposes to restore the site of the existing dwelling to agricultural use;

A written review from the county program administrator of the applicant's proposal, based upon the "Dwelling Relocation Criteria", in accordance with Regulation .03B of this chapter, and any other information that may assist the Foundation in making its decision;
A letter from the local soil conservation district on the feasibility of the landowner's plan to restore the 1-acre site to agricultural use;
A letter of recommendation from the local agricultural land preservation advisory board; and

A written statement from the local planning and zoning office or the county program administrator stating that the landowner's proposal to tear down a dwelling in exchange for a new dwelling on the 1-acre construction site is allowed under local regulations.

section.heading: Agreement.
section.text: If the Foundation approves a landowner's request to relocate a dwelling, the landowner shall enter into a written agreement with the Foundation, to be recorded among the county land records, describing the terms and conditions of the Foundation's approval for the site for the relocation of the dwelling.
